result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda Rae Burr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Dakota County MN case

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Dakota County MN case

10:14 AM Defendant Amanda Rae Burr in court via phone from prison with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros in person.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Walker - include 15CT134.  Walker amended infomation in 15CF205, amended complaint in 15CT134.  15CF205  - Plea to Ct. 1, 4 years in prison, 4 years ES, concurrent with MN Case,  fine in the amount of $518.00.  15CT134, gilty to Ct 1 amended complaint,, dismiss Ct. 2.  $1,744 fine, 65 days jail concurrent with MN case.  24 months IiD, 24 months license suspension.       Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def .    Constitutional rights explained to defendant   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights . Court reviews right to be present in court with defendant.  Defendant waives right to appear in person. Court accepts waiver of right to appear in person.  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct. 1 in 15CF205.  Petros stipulates to factual basis.      COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF205.  15CT134 - Defendant pleads guilty to Ct. 1.  Petros stipulates to factual basis.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CT134.  Ct. 2 is dismissed.  Walker addresses court regarding sentencing.  Petros addresses court regarding sentencing.  Court orders:
15CF205 - 8 years in WI prison system,  4 years inintial confinement,  4 years ES, concurrent with Dakota County MN case,  court costs - $518.00  JOC will reflect 223 days credit if ES is revoked.
15CT134:    Fine  $1,744, 4 years of extended supervision time to pay   
 24  Month Revocation of License
65 days in Pierce County Jail, concurrent to time served in MN case.  
Assessment and Drivers Safety Plan
24 month  IID  and $50.00 surcharge IID commences when the Def. obtains any DL, or decides to drive w/o valid DL.
Appeal rights are given
10:35 a.m.
from Atty. Petros re: case and Defendant's status - in Shakopee Women's Prison.

Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.    Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.    Defendant enters not guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2 at preliminary hearing.    Not guilty plea received by the court.    The bond will continue as ordered.  Bond conditions reviewed with defendant.  Pretrial Conference to be set. Defendant Amanda Rae Burr in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Bo McGraw will take over pro hac vice for Defendant, will be filing paperwork.  15CT134 and 15TR1381 to follow.    Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.    Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

4:06 Defendant Amanda Rae Burr in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Christopher Petros in person with Def. 15CT134 heard at this time.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads the charging portion of 15CT134.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to 15CT134. THorie asks for a $1000 sig bond. Petros has no objection. Court orders the $1000 signature bond. 15CF205:  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Thorie: $10,000 signature bond. Petros no objection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
